comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content:
My new word of the Day  ASTRAKHAN

Nasty and Expensive Fur

Astrakhan or Broadtail fur coats are made from lambs younger than ten days old. Since the lamb skin thickens after three days, the baby lambs are killed by the time they are three days old. To fetch the best quality and to reap the highest profit, farmers kill the mother and remove the lamb from her womb. The fetus is then killed and skinned. A coat made of this "quality" of skin can start around $25k, while coats made from 3 day old lambs can start at $5k.
